p: The tested S. Typhimurium isolates were less sensitive to the assayed EOs when compared with S. Enteritidis strains. In fact, inhibition zones ranged from 7.0 mm to 13.0 mm. The lowest antimicrobial activity was observed in A. triphylla, C. citratus, L. cubeba and M. piperita EOs, with an average inhibition zone of 7.0 mm. S. Typhimurium 261 and 176 were the most sensitive strains to C. zeylanicum showing inhibition zones of 10.0 mm and 13.0 mm, respectively, whereas the remaining S. Typhimurium strains had zones of 7.0 mm. The inhibition zone ranged from 9.0 mm to 11.0 mm for S. aromaticum and from 9.0 mm to 13.0 mm for the mixture.
